Total_Links:
Q1 FY26 Results (as of August 13, 2025):Godrej Industries reported a consolidated net sales of ₹5,779.69 crore, up 26.55% year-on-year.

Net Profit:The company announced a net profit of ₹349 crore for Q1 FY26, compared to ₹322 crore in Q1 FY25, an increase of 8%.

Standalone Net Loss (June 2025 Quarter):Godrej Industries reported a standalone net loss of ₹29.98 crore.

Standalone Net Sales (March 2025):Standalone net sales were reported at ₹1,086.41 crore, up 58.78% year-on-year.

Stake Transfer in Godrej Capital (August 13, 2025):Godrej Industries decided to transfer its entire stake in Godrej Capital Ltd (GCL) to a new wholly-owned subsidiary, Godrej FS Ltd (GFSL), valued at up to ₹4,000 crore.

Investment in GFSL:The company plans an initial investment of up to ₹5,000 crore in GFSL.

Shareholding Pattern (as of June 2025):Promoter holding increased to 70.97% from 67.69% in September 2024. Foreign Institutional Investors (FII) holding decreased to 5.66% from 8.38% in the same period.

CSR Initiatives:Godrej Industries has ongoing CSR initiatives focusing on employability, health and well-being, and environmental sustainability. These include:

Empowering 300,000 people with skills and livelihood support.

Protecting 30 million people against vector-borne diseases.

Implementing efficient waste management systems impacting 10 million people.
